L., Cress, U., and Reimann, P. (Eds.). Transforming Learning, Empowering Learners: The International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2016, Volume 2. Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences, pp. 35-43. https://doi.dx.org/10.22318/icls2016.152 Calculus is a passport for STEM-related careers. In response, this thought experiment analyzes the current nature and state of pre-calculus, drawing attention to a common and problematic approach to teaching function. I argue that this approach to function fosters a kind of thinking that conflicts with the kind of thinking required for a conceptual understanding of calculus and suggest one way to support teaching and learning of pre-calculus is to highlight the features of function that are fundamental to calculus. I suggest that this can be done through carefully constructed mathematical tasks and present a framework for task development. en Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences Supporting Calculus Learning Through “Smooth” Covariation Book chapter <dc:subject xml:lang="en">covariation</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">pre-calculus</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">calculus</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">smooth function</dc:subject>
